intro: Aiouea macedoana, commonly known as the Macaronesian aiouea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showing adaptations to the island's unique climate. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
